Key Match Events: Randal Kolo Muani scored the first goal for France after Dembele's mishit shot was pushed out by Belgian goalkeeper Koen Casteels.
Ousmane Dembele scored the second goal for France with a fine individual effort, blasting a shot into the net on his left foot.
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps expressed relief and happiness with the team's reaction and performance against Belgium after a disappointing loss to Italy.
Deschamps acknowledged that while the performance against Belgium was good, it does not mean everything is now wonderful or fixed.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a repeat of the Euro 2024 last-16 tie which France won 1-0 in Duesseldorf.
France made eight changes to their lineup, including dropping captain Kylian Mbappe.
Belgium was captained by Kevin De Bruyne.
France and Belgium both have three points in Group A2, while Italy leads with six points.
